text: Mexico competed at the 1973 World Aquatics Championships in Belgrade, Yugoslavia from August 31 to September 9. ==Diving== {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%;" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Preliminaries !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Porfirio Becerril |align=left rowspan=2|Men's springboard |399.78 |18 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Carlos Girón |496.89 |10 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Men's platform |454.47 |10 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|José Robinson |445.86 |11 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Norma Baraldi |align=left|Women's springboard |284.91 |22 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Women's platform |256.71 |20 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Alicija Rivera |align=left|Women's springboard |269.88 |23 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|Women's platform |225.24 |21 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== *Competition results World Aquatics Championships Category:Nations at the 1973 World Aquatics Championships 1973
title: Mexico at the 1973 World Aquatics Championships
